result.execSummary:
The defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Chazz Anthony Loyd is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Chazz Anthony Loyd was found guilty of OWI (2nd), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Chazz Anthony Loyd was found guilty of Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Michael L. Chernin.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Statements made as to Sentencing by both counsel and the Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1: COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 60 DAYS in the House of Correction (HOC), consecutive to Count 3 and any other sentence with credit for 2 days time served.  Huber privileges pursuant to Sec. 303.08 Wis.  Stats to apply for work, child care, and treatment. REPORT DATE 10-28-2016 BY 05:00 pm (1700 hrs.)

AS TO COUNT 3:  COURT ORDERED THE Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction(HOC) to run consecutive to Count 1 time served.  Huber privileges under Sec.303.08 Wis. Stats. to apply for work, child care, and treatment.  

Court IMPOSED AND STAYED the sentence and placed Defendant on Probation, as to Count 3, with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 1 Year with the following conditions:
*  No new law violations reaching the level of a probable cause finding.
*  Cooperate with agent.
*  As to Count 1, pay a fine of $350.00 plus costs out of bail on deposit, if any; and the balance due prior to the end of the probationary period.  Failure to pay shall result in a Civil Judgment with tax intercept.
*  Maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
*  AODA assessment with follow up care and treatment.
*  Participate in parenting classes.
*  16 MONTHS suspension of driver's privileges.
*  16 MONTHS Ignition Interlock Device
*  As to Count 3 the Court waives all other costs due tot he Defendant is indigent.

 
Received and filed with the court:
*  Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief Form
*  Court Order For IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan Form
*  Sentencing Referral Form

Court ordered case adjourned for Sentencing in Branch 45.

AS TO COUNT 2:  On motion of the State Court ordered Count 2 DISMISSED.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court pro-se.  Kelly O'Neill appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: TC. For reasons stated on the record as to colliquey held in Honorable Judge Dallet's Court (#15CM2260). 

Indigency hearing proceeded.  Based upon the defendant's statements, the court found the defendant eligible for appointment of counsel at county expense.  The court appointed Attorney Michael Chernin to represent the defendant; Attorney Michael Chernin to be paid at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  The court ordered the defendant to repay Milwaukee County for attorney fees at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing November 1, 2015.  Failure to make timely payments according to the imposed payment schedule may result in a civil judgment.  Order signed and filed.  Court ordered case adjourned for status of counsel in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for October 28, 2015 at 08:30 am.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report received and filed.   rmm

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court pro-se.  Brittany Skye Kachingwe appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk: TC. Case calendared for pre-trial conference. Pro-se defendant is not public defender eligible, additional time needed to retain counsel.   Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 37.  Status conference scheduled for September 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
  No driving without a valid license.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in court with attorney Joan E. Zawikowski.  Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd in custody.  Chad Wozniak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge DEE.
Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel.   Defendant entered a plea of not guilty.  DEFENDANT DOES  NOT QUALIFY FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER  REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED FROM CUSTODY.  Case is adjourned for pretrial in Branch 37.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for August 13, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE BENCH  WARRANT.
Defendant Chazz Anthony Loyd not in court.  Jennifer Lynn Williams appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued.
